newsitem.title: USA: Enron in alliance with Calif. power agency.
newsitem.headline: Enron in alliance with Calif. power agency.

text.p: Enron Corp said its subsidiary Enron Capital & Trade Resources has entered into a strategic alliance with the Northern California Power Agency (NCPA) to manage power supply and energy sales.

Once the alliance is approved, Enron will provide NCPA's 700,000 customers with a package of services including the sale of natural gas and financial and risk management products, Enron said in a statement Wednesday.

The NCPA was established in 1968 as a non-profit organization to buy and sell electricity and energy to its 15 primarily municipal members serving customers in central and northern California, Enron said.
The alliance will give NCPA's customers lower energy bills and access to options like levelized energy billing, single-source billing for power and gas, and other utility services, Enron said.
The agreement is the first of its kind in California, Enron said, adding it was made in response to a law passed last year deregulating California's power industry.
Enron said California's electric rates are 50 percent higher than the national average, and that deregulation was expected to lead to lower power rates for consumers and a more robust energy market.

NCPA's members include the municipalities of Alameda, Biggs, Gridley, Healdsburg, Lodi, Lompoc, Palo Alto, Redding, Roseville, Santa Clara, and Ukiah as well as the Plumas-Sierra Rural Electric Cooperative, the Port of Oakland, the Truckee-Donner Public Utility District and the Turlock Irrigation District.
